As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences or emotions, but I can provide you with some general information.

It is widely believed that native speakers of tonal languages, such as Vietnamese or Thai, may have an advantage when learning Mandarin Chinese due to their prior experience with tonal distinctions. These individuals may have an easier time distinguishing the four Mandarin tones and the neutral tone, which are essential to Mandarin Chinese pronunciation.

However, even for native speakers of tone languages, learning Mandarin Chinese can still present challenges. Vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure are all different in Mandarin Chinese, which means that even these individuals will need to devote time and effort to learning the language.

Overall, while prior experience with tonal languages may provide a helpful foundation for learning Mandarin Chinese, it is not a guarantee of success. Practice, dedication, and perseverance are necessary for anyone seeking to master a new language.
